Package lexer

Class Lexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • lexer.Lexer
  • public class Lexer
extends java.lang.Object
    The lexer is the class that takes in sourcecode of a .ez file and converts matching text into tokens for the parser
    Author:
    Berlian K

    • Constructor Detail

      • Lexer

        public Lexer​(java.lang.String sourceCode)
        This constructor is fed sourcecode from the EZlang client for lexical analysis. It also inserts keywords in resKeywords HashMap for tokenizing reserved keywords
        Parameters:
        sourceCode -

    • Method Detail

      • getTokenList

        public java.util.List<Token> getTokenList()
        Returns:
        Returns a list of tokens that the parser will use

      • LexicalAnalysis

        public void LexicalAnalysis()
        This method performs lexical analysis on the source code. It turns code that matches tokens into tokens and puts them into a token list. Once all the source code has been analyzed, an end of file token is made and inserted into the token list.

      • tokenizeChar

        private void tokenizeChar()
        Helper method for turning chars into char tokens

      • tokenizeString

        private void tokenizeString()
        Helper method for turning strings into string tokens

      • tokenizeID

        private void tokenizeID()
        Helper method for turning identifiers into ID tokens

      • next

        private char next()
        method that iterates to the next char in the source code and returns the previous char
        Returns:
        the previous char after having moved to the subsequent char

      • match

        private boolean match​(char input)
        method that checks for second char in 2 character tokens. Specifically, is looking for = in !=, <=, etc.
        Parameters:
        input - checks if current char matches input char
        Returns:
        boolean if char matches expected char or not

      • getCurrChar

        private char getCurrChar()
        method that returns current char
        Returns:
        the current char

      • getNextChar

        private char getNextChar()
        Returns next char or terminates string if end of file has been reached.
        Returns:
        the next char

      • checkLetter

        private boolean checkLetter​(char c)
        Parameters:
        input - char that is checked if it is a letter or _
        Returns:
        boolean depending if input char is a letter or _

      • checkNumber

        private boolean checkNumber​(char c)
        Parameters:
        input - char that is checked if it is a number or not
        Returns:
        boolean that depends if input char is a number or not

      • tokenizeNumber

        private void tokenizeNumber()
        Helper method for tokenizing numbers

      • tokenize

        private void tokenize​(TokenType tokenType)
        Method that makes tokens for tokens with no values
        Parameters:
        The - token type of a corresponding token

      • tokenize

        private void tokenize​(TokenType tokenType,
                      java.lang.Object literal)
        Method that makes tokens for tokens with values
        Parameters:
        tokenType - The type of the token
        literal - The value of the token

      • checkEnd

        private boolean checkEnd()
        method that checks if all chars have been iterated through i.e. end of file has been reached
        Returns:
        boolean that depends if the end of the file has been reached
